channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This Gen Xer sold his tech company to AT&T for billions—he warns if you’re still pushing RTO, you’re not serious about AI
item.description: ‘The best companies are going to dump their offices to learn to work with non-bodied employees,” serial tech founder, Brian O’Kelley, exclusively tell...

item.title: As ABC’s Kimmel suspension ends, a look back at Trump’s other key media disputes
item.description: President Donald Trump’s contentious relationship with U.S. news organizations has led to a host of legal battles and disputes, the latest of which ca...

item.title: Secret Service Dismantles Telecom Threat Around U.N.
item.description: Investigators say it could have crippled cell towers, jammed 911 calls and flooded networks with chaos at the moment New York City was most vulnerable...

item.title: Is the return-to-office push backfiring on employers?
item.description: A 2024 study of S&P 500 firms found that companies often mandated a return to the office after stock prices fell—hoping in-person work would spark pro...

item.title: Silicon Valley is reeling from Trump’s new H-1B visa fees
item.description: The Trump administration’s hefty new visa fees for H-1B workers have prompted high-level talks inside companies in Silicon Valley and beyond on the po...

item.title: Disney Changed Its Mind on Jimmy Kimmel and It’s a Dangerous Lesson For Every Leader
item.description: Kimmel’s show returns on Tuesday, but the implications of Disney’s decisions will continue much longer.

item.title: How to watch ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’: ABC late-night host returns tonight after Disney suspension
item.description: Nearly a week after Disney “indefinitely” suspended Jimmy Kimmel for comments he’d made regarding the killing of conservative commentator Charlie Kirk...

item.title: Why Real Change Requires More Than Disruption
item.description: Disruption has brought us some great innovations—and destruction. Creating lasting change requires a more constructive tactic.

item.title: Meet Erika Kirk, the 36-year-old CEO of Turning Point USA, who has three degrees, two kids, and a clothing brand
item.description: Erika Kirk has inherited one of the most influential conservative organizations in America after the assassination of her husband, Charlie Kirk.

item.title: How Ben Goodwin Launched Olipop to Disrupt the Soda Market
item.description: The founder developed his company to sate consumers’ thirst for healthier options.

item.title: Palantir CEO says Gen Z can either have a social life at age 20 or be successful—but they can’t do both
item.description: Gen Z may crave work-life balance, but Palantir boss Alex Karp says the only way to win big is to give up their social life.

item.title: Social Security chief says he won’t hike the retirement age amid the strain of America’s aging population and fears of benefit cuts
item.description: The administration continues to frame its approach around protecting benefits while exploring other avenues to bolster solvency.

item.title: Want to Live a Longer, Healthier Life? Recent Science Says Your Genetics Are Only 2 Percent of the Longevity Equation
item.description: How you’re made does impact how long you’ll live, but what contributes more? What you do on a regular basis.

item.title: Companies are loudly calling themselves ‘AI-first.’ Are they helping or hurting their own brands?
item.description: Last week, the online freelance marketplace Fiverr generated a flood of headlines after it announced an effort to reimagine itself as an “ AI -first” ...

item.title: ‘Shark Tank’ star Lori Greiner doesn’t believe in a 5 a.m. wake-up call: ‘Waking up early doesn’t give you more time. It simply shifts your schedule’
item.description: The “Queen of QVC” wakes up at 8 a.m. to match her body’s natural energy. "Success is about maximizing your energy," she says.
